pr_title: If the requested slot is empty, get the block header for the latest block.

timeline.message:
If the current slot is empty, get the block header for the latest block.

 - Previously an empty head slot would result in a 404 (not found) error.

 - It was possible for the slot of the finalized epoch to be empty, which would result in 404.

 - Retrieval of a specific slot may now result in a different slot being returned by `/eth/v1/beacon/headers/*` endpoints if the numeric requested slot had no block.

 - An empty slot will have the block header from the most recent block at that point, complete with the slot it was produced for.

 fixes #3071

Signed-off-by: Paul Harris <paul.harris@consensys.net>

That way the handler is responsible for interpreting the request and the provider has the business logic.  With it this way the provider is interpreting the request and doing the business logic.
